enWisdom: The miser is dispraised, the envious is disheartened
Stinginess humiliates its possessor and elevates the one who turns away from it
A miser is abased among those who are dear to him
Stinginess earns dishonor and makes one enter hellfire

Wisdom: الْبَاخِلُ فِي الدُّنْيَا مَذْمُومٌ وَفِي الْآخِرَةِ مُعَذَّبٌ مَلُومٌ
enWisdom: A miser is rebuked in this world, and punished and chastised in the Hereafter

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالتَّحَلِّيَ بِالْبُخْلِ فَإِنَّهُ يُزْرِي بِكَ عِنْدَ الْقَرِيبِ [الْغَرِيبِ‏] وَيُمَقِّتُكَ إِلَى النَّسِيبِ [إِلَى الْقَرِيبِ‏]
enWisdom: I bid you not to adorn yourself with stinginess, for it will disparage you near those who are close to you and will make your hated by your relatives
One who is stingy with his wealth is abased

Wisdom: مَا أَذَلَّ النَّفْسَ كَالْحِرْصِ وَلَا شَانَ الْعِرْضَ كَالْبُخْلِ
enWisdom: Nothing debases the self like greed and nothing disgraces [one’s] honour like stinginess
Stinginess is one of the two forms of poverty

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالشُّحَّ فَإِنَّهُ جِلْبَابُ الْمَسْكَنَةِ وَزِمَامٌ يُعَادُ بِهِ إِلَى كُلِّ دَنَاءَةٍ
enWisdom: I bid you to refrain from avarice, for it is the garment of indigence and the bridle that is used to drive one towards every [type of] vileness

Wisdom: لَا تَبْخَلْ فَتُقَتِّرَ وَلَا تُسْرِفْ فَتُفْرِطَ
enWisdom: Do not be stingy by acting tightfistedly; and do not waste by acting extravagantly

Wisdom: لَا تُدْخِلَنَّ فِي مَشُورَتِكَ بَخِيلًا فَيَعْدِلَ بِكَ عَنِ الْقَصْدِ وَيَعِدَكَ الْفَقْرَ
enWisdom: Do not include a miser in your consultation as he will turn you away from the goal and frighten you with poverty

Wisdom: مَنْ قَبَضَ يَدَهُ مَخَافَةَ الْفَقْرِ فَقَدْ تَعَجَّلَ الْفَقْرَ
enWisdom: One who withholds his hand out of fear of poverty has [actually] hastened poverty
